image.altText: Jasmine smiles while wearing a red jacket and black wide-brimmed hat with a cream underside

props.synopsis: A girl who died, allegedly as a result of criminal neglect by her mother, had attended school with bruises and had lunches that "didn't seem" edible, a court has heard. Warning: This story includes references to child abuse and self-harm, which may be distressing to readers.

title.children: Alleged manslaughter victim had bruises and 'off' lunches, court told

image.altText: Toby Sutherland is wearing a Bedford jumper and smiling.

props.synopsis: Workers at disability employment provider Bedford reveal their joy at learning their jobs are secure with the announcement of a preferred buyer, following months of uncertainty.

title.children: Bedford workers relief for 'steady future' as buyer announced

image.altText: Parent Luke Driscoll stands holding his daughter outside of his home in Broken Hill.

props.synopsis: One of the few childcare operators in Broken Hill has closed its doors indefinitely with 24 hours warning after entering voluntary administration.

title.children: Parents in 'childcare desert' scrambling as operator goes into administration

image.altText: An asbestos removal truck at an Adelaide school site.

props.synopsis: The number of public school sites in South Australia that have reported coloured sand linked to an asbestos contamination scare rises above 350, but education authorities say there is no plan for closures at this stage.

title.children: More than 350 SA schools detect sand linked to asbestos scare

image.altText: Aerial view of a mining site. The dirt is orange and brown.

props.synopsis: A mine in South Australia's Murray Mallee is ceasing operations and says it will rehabilitate the site back to its original condition. However, the site's owner says the land will never get back to what it was before mining.

title.children: Landholder says mine company's promise to revegetate site not possible

image.altText: Para-cyclist standing on the top step of podium, smiling, gold medal around her neck, holding flowers.

props.synopsis: Heartfelt tributes from across the Australian sporting landscape have flooded social media after the death of Paralympic and world champion para-cyclist Paige Greco.

title.children: Tributes flow after death of Paralympic champion Paige Greco

image.altText: A man wearing a blue suit stands beside a TV displaying pictures of a child and woman

props.synopsis: Police search two homes linked to a suspect in the investigation into the murder of Adelaide woman Rosemary Brown and the disappearance of her 15-year-old daughter, Melissa Trussell.

title.children: Knife found in murdered mother, missing daughter cold case probe

image.altText: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese wears black-rimmed glasses and a black suit jacket with a silver tie.

props.synopsis: As Chris Bowen lands in Belém with the clock ticking on a resolution, Anthony Albanese says the rules against co-presidency for the COP are clear.

title.children: Sharing COP presidency with Türkiye 'not an option', says Albanese

image.altText: Animation design of desalination plan

props.synopsis: Completion of the South Australian government’s Northern Water desalination plant and water pipeline is now forecast to occur in 2032.

title.children: $5b SA desal plant and pipeline network expected to take longer to finish

image.altText: A fast bowler in his follow-through after bowling during a red-ball cricket match

props.synopsis: Fast bowler Brendan Doggett says he learned he could make a Test debut while waiting to bat in South Australia's Sheffield Shield run chase last week against Tasmania.

title.children: Tradie set for long-awaited Test debut, seven years after first taste

image.altText: Two fighters in the ring.

props.synopsis: The organiser of this fight club says it saves lives. But critics say it is putting young men at serious risk.

title.children: The Hood Contender pits men against each other in 'deeply disturbing' combat

image.altText: Graphic showing Jimmy Barnes singing into a microphone with a yellow and black background with rural farm scenes.

props.synopsis: Forget the Hottest 100 music countdown, farmers have their own annual music poll to get though the long harvest after two consecutive years of drought.

title.children: When you work till 3am harvesting grain, these songs keep you going

image.altText: Hannah sitting in the sun smiling with a drink in hand.

props.synopsis: Lachlan Young strangled Ms McGuire in their Sebastopol home, then placed her body in her ute and set it alight in bushland on Ballarat's outskirts, staging the scene to look like a suicide.

title.children: Lachlan Young sentenced to 28 years' jail for murdering Hannah McGuire

image.altText: A tracking map over the NT, showing a tropical low headed towards the NT coast.

props.synopsis: The Bureau of Meteorology has issued its first forecast track map for a tropical low over the NT, showing the system is expected to strengthen into a category two cyclone by Thursday night.

title.children: Category two cyclone predicted off NT coast by Thursday

image.altText: A person holding a smartphone dialling 000

props.synopsis: TPG Telecom says a Sydney customer died after outdated software blocked a Samsung phone from making Triple Zero calls.

title.children: Outdated Samsung software behind failed Triple Zero call death, telco says

image.altText: Nine women stand in aprons and hair nets behind a food stall.

props.synopsis: A Vanuatu provincial government says it will repeal parts of its new bylaw banning menstruating women from preparing and selling food at markets and roadside stalls after the decision sparked a public outcry.

title.children: Vanuatu council U-turns on 'absurd' period ban

image.altText: Penny Wong looks at Anthony Albanese at a press confernece

props.synopsis: Penny Wong has demanded "full accountability" and "transparency" from Laos over the methanol deaths of two Australian women last year.

title.children: Wong says Laos methanol deaths investigation 'not good enough' — as it happened

image.altText: Donald Trump sits at a desk in the Oval Office.

props.synopsis: The bill — to direct the US Justice Department to release its documents about late sex offender Jeffrey Epstein — now looks set to sail through the House of Representatives.

title.children: Trump says he would sign bill to release Epstein files

image.altText: Eliesa Katoa of Tonga is attended to by a trainer, holding a towel, bleeding an with head injuries

props.synopsis: Melbourne Storm star Eli Katoa will miss the 2026 NRL season as he continues his recovery from head knocks that forced him to have brain surgery.

title.children: Storm star to miss entire NRL season after shocking Test head knocks

image.altText: A multi-storey office building behind a fence.

props.synopsis: Legal Aid NT says it will refuse all new criminal clients who are not already in custody, including children as young as 10, due to funding constraints.

title.children: Ten-year-olds facing jail could be forced to go without a lawyer in the NT

image.altText: a small old urn

props.synopsis: Ahead of the 2025/26 Ashes series getting underway on November 21 in Perth, test out your knowledge in our fiendish Ashes quiz.

title.children: Think you know the Ashes? Try our fiendish quiz to find out

image.altText: Man from behind sitting down at the beach staring at the water

props.synopsis: While the childcare crisis has left me concerned about my own child's safety, as a male early childhood educator, I'm also worried about the future of men in the sector, writes Ben.

title.children: I'm a male early childhood educator. I worry about my son in care

image.altText: A large storm cloud over the ocean.

props.synopsis: The fleet of the 1998 Sydney to Hobart yacht race set sail from the harbour city, unaware they were travelling directly into the path of a huge storm and unrelenting swell that would throw the race into disarray and claim six lives.

title.children: How these crew members survived 'violent monster waves' at sea

image.altText: An image of the UN security council members voting.

props.synopsis: The UN Security Council approves a US plan for Gaza that authorises an international stabilisation force to provide security in the devastated territory.

title.children: UN Security Council backs US plan for Gaza

image.altText: An up close of Mark Speakman.

props.synopsis: The leadership of the NSW Liberals remains in doubt with Mark Speakman's future in a perilous position. It comes as a new leader has been elected for the NSW Nationals.

title.children: NSW Liberal leadership under a cloud as Nats appoint new leader

image.altText: CFMEu sign Brisbane

props.synopsis: A probe into the CFMEU has begun in Brisbane, examining allegations of bullying, violence and misogyny at the powerful construction union.

title.children: First witness in CFMEU inquiry says bosses 'revelled' in being feared

image.altText: An old lady walks down a street with buildings damaged by military strikes behind her.

props.synopsis: Recently released video shows a "Mad Max-style" convoy entering Pokrovsk in Ukraine's east on motorcycles and in ramshackle cars, in what experts say is part of Russia's latest push to take the city.

title.children: Russian troops advance in 'Mad Max-style' convoy, desperate to take strategic Ukrainian city

image.altText: Four smiling siblings standing arm-in-arm in front of a football field

props.synopsis: Willem Duursma's dancing feet could carry him all the way to the number-one pick at tomorrow night's AFL National Draft.

title.children: From Tangled to the AFL draft, Willem Duursma is dancing to the top

image.altText: A grainy image of a man with a beard, wearing a white shirt, staring straight at the camera with no smile.

props.synopsis: Details of how a Sydney underworld figure was tracked by his would-be killers have been revealed for the first time in court as it emerged a 19-year-old charged vowed to an associate: "brother I would never snitch".

title.children: 19yo allegedly told 'he didn't die' when gangland murder target survived

image.altText: A large crowd of people holding signs while marching in front of Queensland parliament.

props.synopsis: The union has confirmed it will go ahead with protected industrial action on November 25, with teachers to walk off the job for a day.

title.children: Queensland teachers to strike for second time amid pay dispute

image.altText: a teddy bear and flower sit outside an apartment complex

props.synopsis: The 48-year-old man pleaded guilty to murdering his three-year-old son in a unit in Sydney's south-west two years ago.

title.children: 'I'll probably get 30 years': Father admits to murdering toddler son

image.altText: Base of Mount Anne, Tasmania, photo by Ben Wilkinson

props.synopsis: Police say the two women were "reasonably prepared" but worsening weather meant they were cold, wet and unable to continue their journey.

title.children: Weather hampers rescue of hikers stranded on Tasmania's Mount Anne

image.altText: Willem Duursma looks on during a game for Vic Country

props.synopsis: With the AFL draft just around the corner, see which picks each club has to work with and the players they could select.

title.children: AFL draft club by club: Every team's picks and potential targets

image.altText: A pedestrian and cyclist goes across the Causeway footpath as traffic crosses on the road adjacent.

props.synopsis: The Boorloo Bridge, which connects Perth's inner southern suburbs with the CBD, will remain closed until at least Wednesday after lighting cables fell across the commuter structure on Monday.

title.children: 'The fastening didn't hold': New $198m bridge closed after safety issue

image.altText: Nirvana frontman Kurt Cobain in a mohair cardigan, sitting with a semi-acoustic guitar for MTV's Unplugged.

props.synopsis: It was nearly a disaster, but Nirvana going acoustic for MTV ended up being one of the most iconic live performances ever and cemented Kurt Cobain as a tortured genius.

title.children: Kurt Cobain's most unnerving performance — and why he hated it
